body:
@adamjstewart this one is for you.
Basically, I tried to build openfoam and among its dependencies, there is py-matplotlib which is unable to find ImageMagick libraries even though they are installed and in the proper location.

<!-- Thanks for taking the time to report this build failure. To proceed with the report please:

1. Title the issue "Installation issue: <name-of-the-package>".
2. Provide the information required below.

We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively! -->

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install openfoam@2012+int64+kahip+metis+mgridgen+paraview+vtk ^cairo+X+gobject+pdf ^hdf5+cxx~debug+fortran+hl+mpi+pic+shared+szip+threadsafe ^paraview@5.6.2+hdf5+python3+qt build_type=Release ^py-matplotlib+animation+latex+movies backend=qt5cairo ^qt+gtk+opengl ^vtk@8.1.2+python+qt build_type=Release
...
==> Installing py-matplotlib-3.4.1-i54zjrlstw6ragjt55tayjryoqwee3sg
==> No binary for py-matplotlib-3.4.1-i54zjrlstw6ragjt55tayjryoqwee3sg found: installing from source
...
==> Error: NoLibrariesError: Unable to recursively locate imagemagick libraries in /var/lib/localadmin/stack/stack.v0.16.x/opt/zen2/imagemagick/7.0.8-7-gcc-op5z7vv

/var/lib/localadmin/stack/stack.v0.16.x/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/py-matplotlib/package.py:167, in setup_build_environment:
        164        for dep in self.spec.dependencies(deptype='link'):
        165            query = self.spec[dep.name]
        166            include.extend(query.headers.directories)
  >>    167            library.extend(query.libs.directories)
        168
        169        # Build uses a mix of Spack's compiler wrapper and the actual compiler,
        170        # so this is needed to get parts of the build working.
```
However, the imagemagick library seems to be properly installed and the libraries are there:

```console
$ ll /var/lib/localadmin/stack/stack.v0.16.x/opt/zen2/imagemagick/7.0.8-7-gcc-op5z7vv/lib/
total 86668
drwxr-sr-x. 3 localadmin localadmin     4096 Apr  7 06:59 ImageMagick-7.0.8
-rw-r--r--. 1 localadmin localadmin 14091966 Apr  7 06:59 libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.a
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 localadmin localadmin       30 Apr  7 06:59 libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.so -> libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.so.4.0.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 localadmin localadmin       30 Apr  7 06:59 libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.so.4 -> libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.so.4.0.0
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 localadmin localadmin  5335488 Apr  7 06:59 libMagick++-7.Q16HDRI.so.4.0.0
-rw-r--r--. 1 localadmin localadmin 37703538 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.a
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 localadmin localadmin       32 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.so -> libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.so.6.0.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 localadmin localadmin       32 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.so.6 -> libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.so.6.0.0
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 localadmin localadmin 19694920 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickCore-7.Q16HDRI.so.6.0.0
-rw-r--r--. 1 localadmin localadmin  7799584 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickWand-7.Q16HDRI.a
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 localadmin localadmin       32 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickWand-7.Q16HDRI.so -> libMagickWand-7.Q16HDRI.so.6.0.0

-rwxr-xr-x. 1 localadmin localadmin  4104136 Apr  7 06:59 libMagickWand-7.Q16HDRI.so.6.0.0
```
